title: Swedish Research Council
text:
Swedish Research Council

The Swedish Research Council (Swedish: Vetenskapsr√•det) is a Government agency in Sweden established in 2001, with the responsibility to support and develop basic scientific research. Its objective is for Sweden to be a leading nation in scientific research. The agency has three main functions:

  • To distribute government funding for basic research
  • To advise the government on issues related to scientific research
  • To communicate science and scientific research to the general public
summary:
The Swedish Research Council is a Government agency in Sweden established in 2001, with the responsibility to support and develop basic scientific research. Its objective is for Sweden to be a leading nation in scientific research. The agency has three main functions:To distribute government funding for basic research
To advise the government on issues related to scientific research
To communicate science and scientific research to the general public
